title: Which countries' high schools are the most difficult? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are undoubtedly some high schools in the United States that rank among the toughest in the world, but this is not true about the country's schools in general. I'd recommend reading The Smartest Kids in the World: : And How They Got That Way by Amanda Ripley (not the character from Alien!) For a quickie overview of what the book talks about, she was interviewed on NPR at What Makes The 'Smartest Kids In The World'? and on the KCRW podcast This… is Interesting: The Smartest Kids in the World Are Not in the U.S. The book was reviewed at the New York Times: Likely to Succeed. And the publisher even created a "preview":

In my opinion, they are as hard as you want them to be. There are AP classes which are much harder than regular classes. There's always something to challenge yourself with. If you take all regular classes and maintain C's, it should be pretty easy, given that American education is known to be inferior to other developed countries. When I visit China, I get the feeling that American schools are a lot easier!
